Welcome to Taskmage’s documentation!¶

Contents:

A module that manages task lists.

Exported Classes:

TaskListCSV – Manages task lists with a .csv file backend.

Task – Defines task properties.

class taskmage.Task(uid=None, summary=None, description=None, date=None, status='needs-action', logged_time=0)¶

Define task properties.

Data attributes:

uid¶
Unique identifier for the task.
summary¶
Summary of the task.
description¶
Longer description of the task.
date¶
Creation date of the task.
status¶
Status of the task; can be one of ‘needs-action’, ‘in-process’, ‘completed’, ‘cancelled’. Default for new tasks is ‘needs-action’.
logged_time¶
Time, in seconds, that has been spent on the task.
class taskmage.TaskListCSV¶

Manage task list with a .csv file backend.

Data attributes:

tasks¶
A list of Task objects.

Public functions:

add_task – Add a Task object to the task list.

filter_tasks – Return a list of tasks that match certain criteria.

read_tasks – Read tasks from .csv file.

write_tasks – Write tasks to .csv file.

add_task(task)¶

Add a Task object to the task list.

Parameter:task – Task object to append. Currently, no check is made to ensure this is indeed a Task instance.

Append task to tasks and return it.

filter_tasks(**kwargs)¶

Return a list of tasks that match certain criteria.

Parameter:**kwargs – A dictionary whose keys are Task object attributes and whose values are lists of desired values for each attribute. For example:

{status: [‘needs-action’, ‘in-process’]}

Iterate attributes in **kwargs; for each attribute, iterate tasks and append current task to a set if the task attribute is included in the filter values for that attribute. Return a list of tasks that match all criteria.

read_tasks()¶

Read tasks from .csv file.

For each line in the tasks.csv file, split its contents and create a Task object. Append each object to tasks.

write_tasks()¶

Write tasks to .csv file.

Iterate tasks and write each line to the tasks.csv file.

taskmage_curses.add_task()¶

Add a task.

Create new Task object, append it to the task list and adjust the items dictionary and the task pad height accordingly. Draw the updated list, with the newly added task selected.

taskmage_curses.done_task(offset)¶

Mark task done.

Change selected task’s status to ‘completed’, remove it from the task list and synchronize the items dictionary.

taskmage_curses.draw_tasks(offset=0, selected=0)¶

Draw task list on screen, highlighting selected task.

Parameters:
  • offset – Offset of the task pad.
  • selected – Index of selected item.
taskmage_curses.get_input(prompt_string)¶
Read input string from user.
taskmage_curses.main(stdscr)¶

Main program loop.

Parameter:stdscr – Curses main screen.

Draw initial list of tasks, wait for input and act accordingly.

taskmage_curses.move(window, display_function, smaxrow, offset, operation_string)¶

Select previous or next item in list.

Parameters:
  • window – Curses pad object where movement will occur.
  • display_function – Function to display the list.
  • smaxrow – Last row of pad being diplayed.
  • offset – Current offset of this pad.
  • operation_string – ‘add’ or ‘sub’, for moving up or down, respectively

Calculate the next item index and display list, with that item selected. Return the new offset.

taskmage_curses.show_details(task)¶

Show details of selected task.

Parameter:task – Task object corresponding to the selected item

Write details of selected task to the details window.

taskmage_curses.sync_items(tasks)¶

Synchronize items dictionary with current task list.

Parameter:tasks – list of Task objects

Return a dictionary where keys are integers and values are Task instances.

taskmage_curses.write_status(status)¶

Write text in status bar.

Parameter:status – String of text to be written in the status bar

After writing the provided text in the status bar, return cursor to its previous location.
